newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian Sabena says close to deal with unions.
newsitem.headline: Belgian Sabena says close to deal with unions.

text.p: Belgian national airline Sabena said on Wednesday it expected to finalise on Thursday a crucial deal with trade unions on a 4.7 billion Belgian franc ($149.7 million) recovery plan, a spokesman for the carrier said.
"It's too early to rejoice but normally it should all be over tomorrow, we should be able to meet the target date of October 31," Erik Sclep told Reuters.
Sabena, owned 49.5 percent by Swissair, has been negotiating since mid-June on chief executive Paul Reutlinger's 'Horizon 98' savings plan.

Management will account for 2.7 billion francs of the savings, but the rest has to come from labour-related cost reductions and is sought through a combination of job cuts, staff flexibility and internal transfers.
